what: Download CNES Health Facility Registry Data — cnes_data
title: Download CNES Health Facility Registry Data — cnes_data
text: Downloads returns health facility registry data DATASUS FTP. row represents one health facility record (ST type). Data organized monthly – one .dbc file per type, state (UF), month.

title: Download CNES Health Facility Registry Data — cnes_data
code: cnes_data(   year,   type = "ST",   month = NULL,   vars = NULL,   uf = NULL,   parse = TRUE,   col_types = NULL,   cache = TRUE,   cache_dir = NULL,   lazy = FALSE,   backend = c("arrow", "duckdb") )

title: Download CNES Health Facility Registry Data — cnes_data
text: year Integer. Year(s) data. Required. type Character. File type download. Default: "ST" (establishments). See cnes_info() 13 types. month Integer. Month(s) data (1-12). NULL (default), downloads 12 months. Example: 1 (January), 1:6 (first semester). vars Character vector. Variables keep. NULL (default), returns available variables. Use cnes_variables() see available variables. uf Character. Two-letter state abbreviation(s) download. NULL (default), downloads 27 states. Example: "SP", c("SP", "RJ"). parse Logical. TRUE (default), converts columns appropriate types (integer, double, Date) based variable metadata. Use cnes_variables() see target type variable. Set FALSE backward-compatible -character output. col_types Named list. Override default type specific columns. Names column names, values type strings: "character", "integer", "double", "date_dmy", "date_ymd", "date_ym", "date". Example: list(COMPETEN = "character") keep COMPETEN character. cache Logical. TRUE (default), caches downloaded data faster future access. cache_dir Character. Directory caching. Default: tools::R_user_dir("healthbR", "cache"). lazy Logical. TRUE, returns lazy query object instead tibble. Requires arrow package. lazy object supports dplyr verbs (filter, select, mutate, etc.) pushed query engine collecting memory. Call dplyr::collect() materialize result. Default: FALSE. backend Character. Backend lazy evaluation: "arrow" (default) "duckdb". used lazy = TRUE. DuckDB backend requires duckdb package.

title: Download CNES Health Facility Registry Data — cnes_data
text: tibble health facility data. Includes columns year, month, uf_source identify source multiple years/months/states combined.

title: Download CNES Health Facility Registry Data — cnes_data
text: Data downloaded DATASUS FTP .dbc files (one per type/state/month). .dbc format decompressed internally using vendored C code blast library. external dependencies required. CNES data monthly, downloading entire year states requires 324 files (27 UFs x 12 months) per type. Use uf month limit downloads. CNES 13 file types. default "ST" (establishments) commonly used. Use cnes_info() see types.

title: Download CNES Health Facility Registry Data — cnes_data
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # all establishments in Acre, January 2023 ac_jan <- cnes_data(year = 2023, month = 1, uf = "AC")  # only key variables cnes_data(year = 2023, month = 1, uf = "AC",           vars = c("CNES", "CODUFMUN", "TP_UNID", "VINC_SUS"))  # hospital beds leitos <- cnes_data(year = 2023, month = 1, uf = "AC", type = "LT")  # health professionals prof <- cnes_data(year = 2023, month = 1, uf = "AC", type = "PF") }

what: healthbR: Access Brazilian Public Health Data — healthbR-package
title: healthbR: Access Brazilian Public Health Data — healthbR-package
text: Provides easy access Brazilian public health data multiple sources including VIGITEL (Surveillance Risk Factors Chronic Diseases Telephone Survey), PNS (National Health Survey), PNAD Continua (Continuous National Household Sample Survey), POF (Household Budget Survey food security consumption data), Censo Demografico (population denominators via SIDRA API), SIM (Mortality Information System), SINASC (Live Birth Information System), SIH (Hospital Information System), SIA (Outpatient Information System), SINAN (Notifiable Diseases Surveillance), CNES (National Health Facility Registry), SI-PNI (National Immunization Program - aggregated 1994-2019 via FTP, individual-level microdata 2020+ via OpenDataSUS API), SISAB (Primary Care Health Information System - coverage indicators via REST API), ANS (Agencia Nacional de Saude Suplementar - supplementary health beneficiaries, consumer complaints, financial statements), ANVISA (Agencia Nacional de Vigilancia Sanitaria - product registrations, pharmacovigilance, hemovigilance, technovigilance, controlled substance sales via SNGPC), health information systems. Data downloaded Brazilian Ministry Health IBGE repositories. Data returned tidy format following tidyverse conventions.

title: healthbR: Access Brazilian Public Health Data — healthbR-package
text: Maintainer: Sidney Bissoli sbissoli76@gmail.com (ORCID)

title: Download PNADC microdata — pnadc_data
text: Downloads returns PNADC microdata specified module year(s) IBGE FTP. Data cached locally avoid repeated downloads. arrow package installed, data cached parquet format faster subsequent reads.

title: Download PNADC microdata — pnadc_data
code: pnadc_data(   module,   year = NULL,   vars = NULL,   as_survey = FALSE,   cache_dir = NULL,   refresh = FALSE,   lazy = FALSE,   backend = c("arrow", "duckdb") )

title: Download PNADC microdata — pnadc_data
text: module Character. module identifier. Use pnadc_modules see available modules. Required. year Numeric vector. Year(s) download. Use NULL available years module. Default NULL. vars Character vector. Variables select. Use NULL variables. Survey design variables (UPA, Estrato, V1028) key demographic variables always included. Default NULL. as_survey Logical. TRUE, returns survey design object (requires srvyr package). Default FALSE. cache_dir Character. Directory caching downloaded files. Default uses tools::R_user_dir("healthbR", "cache"). refresh Logical. TRUE, re-download even file exists cache. Default FALSE. lazy Logical. TRUE, returns lazy query object instead tibble. Requires arrow package. lazy object supports dplyr verbs (filter, select, mutate, etc.) pushed query engine collecting memory. Call dplyr::collect() materialize result. Default: FALSE. backend Character. Backend lazy evaluation: "arrow" (default) "duckdb". used lazy = TRUE. DuckDB backend requires duckdb package.

title: Download PNS microdata — pns_data
text: Downloads returns PNS microdata specified years IBGE FTP. Data cached locally avoid repeated downloads. arrow package installed, data cached parquet format faster subsequent reads.

title: Download PNS microdata — pns_data
code: pns_data(   year = NULL,   vars = NULL,   cache_dir = NULL,   refresh = FALSE,   lazy = FALSE,   backend = c("arrow", "duckdb") )

title: Download PNS microdata — pns_data
text: year Numeric vector. Year(s) download (2013, 2019). Use NULL download available years. Default NULL. vars Character vector. Variables select. Use NULL variables. Default NULL. cache_dir Character. Directory caching downloaded files. Default uses tools::R_user_dir("healthbR", "cache"). refresh Logical. TRUE, re-download even file exists cache. Default FALSE. lazy Logical. TRUE, returns lazy query object instead tibble. Requires arrow package. lazy object supports dplyr verbs (filter, select, mutate, etc.) pushed query engine collecting memory. Call dplyr::collect() materialize result. Default: FALSE. backend Character. Backend lazy evaluation: "arrow" (default) "duckdb". used lazy = TRUE. DuckDB backend requires duckdb package.

what: Get PNS tabulated data from SIDRA API — pns_sidra_data
title: Get PNS tabulated data from SIDRA API — pns_sidra_data
text: Queries IBGE SIDRA API retrieve tabulated PNS indicators. Returns pre-aggregated data (prevalences, means, proportions) confidence intervals coefficients variation.

title: Get PNS tabulated data from SIDRA API — pns_sidra_data
code: pns_sidra_data(   table,   territorial_level = "brazil",   geo_code = "all",   year = NULL,   variable = NULL,   classifications = NULL,   raw = FALSE )

title: Get PNS tabulated data from SIDRA API — pns_sidra_data
text: table Numeric character. SIDRA table code. Use pns_sidra_tables() pns_sidra_search() find codes. territorial_level Character. Geographic level: "brazil" (N1), "region" (N2), "state" (N3), "municipality" (N6). Default "brazil". geo_code Character. IBGE code(s) specific localities. "" returns localities chosen level. Default "". year Numeric. Year(s) query. NULL returns available periods. variable Numeric character. SIDRA variable ID(s). NULL returns variables excluding metadata. Default NULL. classifications Named list. SIDRA classification filters. Example: list("2" = "6794") sex = total. NULL returns default aggregation. Default NULL. raw Logical. TRUE, returns raw API output without cleaning. Default FALSE.

title: Get PNS tabulated data from SIDRA API — pns_sidra_data
text: tibble queried indicators.

title: Get PNS tabulated data from SIDRA API — pns_sidra_data
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # self-rated health by state, 2019 pns_sidra_data(   table = 4751,   territorial_level = "state",   year = 2019 )  # same table, Brazil-level, both years pns_sidra_data(   table = 4751,   territorial_level = "brazil",   year = c(2013, 2019) )  # hypertension data pns_sidra_data(   table = 4416,   territorial_level = "brazil" ) }

code: pof_data(   year = "2017-2018",   register = "morador",   vars = NULL,   cache_dir = NULL,   as_survey = FALSE,   refresh = FALSE,   lazy = FALSE,   backend = c("arrow", "duckdb") )

title: Download and import POF microdata — pof_data
text: year Character. POF edition (e.g., "2017-2018"). Default "2017-2018". register Character. register download. Use pof_registers() see available options. Default "morador". vars Character vector. Optional: specific variables select. NULL, returns variables register. Default NULL. cache_dir Character. Directory caching downloaded files. Default uses tools::R_user_dir("healthbR", "cache"). as_survey Logical. TRUE, returns survey design object. Requires srvyr package. Default FALSE. refresh Logical. TRUE, re-download even file exists cache. Default FALSE. lazy Logical. TRUE, returns lazy query object instead tibble. Requires arrow package. lazy object supports dplyr verbs (filter, select, mutate, etc.) pushed query engine collecting memory. Call dplyr::collect() materialize result. Default: FALSE. backend Character. Backend lazy evaluation: "arrow" (default) "duckdb". used lazy = TRUE. DuckDB backend requires duckdb package.

title: Download and import POF microdata — pof_data
text: tibble microdata, tbl_svy as_survey = TRUE.

title: Download and import POF microdata — pof_data
text: POF (Pesquisa de Orcamentos Familiares) household survey conducted IBGE investigates household budgets, living conditions, nutritional profiles Brazilian population.

title: Download and import POF microdata — pof_data
text: POF contains several health-related modules: EBIA (Food Security Scale): Available 2017-2018, variable V6199 domicilio register Food Consumption: Detailed food consumption data consumo_alimentar register (2008-2009, 2017-2018) Health Expenses: Expenses medications, health insurance, consultations despesa_individual register Anthropometry: Weight, height, BMI morador register (2008-2009 )

title: Download and import POF microdata — pof_data
text: proper statistical analysis complex survey design, use as_survey = TRUE creates survey design object : Weight variable: PESO_FINAL Stratum variable: ESTRATO_POF PSU variable: COD_UPA

title: Download and import POF microdata — pof_data
text: Data downloaded IBGE FTP server: https://ftp.ibge.gov.br/Orcamentos_Familiares/

title: Download and import POF microdata — pof_data
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # basic usage - download morador register morador <- pof_data("2017-2018", "morador", cache_dir = tempdir())  # download domicilio register (includes EBIA) domicilio <- pof_data("2017-2018", "domicilio", cache_dir = tempdir())  # select specific variables df <- pof_data(   "2017-2018", "morador",   vars = c("COD_UPA", "ESTRATO_POF", "PESO_FINAL", "V0403"),   cache_dir = tempdir() )  # with survey design (requires srvyr package) morador_svy <- pof_data("2017-2018", "morador", as_survey = TRUE,                          cache_dir = tempdir()) }

what: Download SIA Outpatient Production Microdata — sia_data
title: Download SIA Outpatient Production Microdata — sia_data
text: Downloads returns outpatient production microdata DATASUS FTP. row represents one outpatient production record. Data organized monthly – one .dbc file per type, state (UF), month.

title: Download SIA Outpatient Production Microdata — sia_data
code: sia_data(   year,   type = "PA",   month = NULL,   vars = NULL,   uf = NULL,   procedure = NULL,   diagnosis = NULL,   parse = TRUE,   col_types = NULL,   cache = TRUE,   cache_dir = NULL,   lazy = FALSE,   backend = c("arrow", "duckdb") )

title: Download SIA Outpatient Production Microdata — sia_data
text: year Integer. Year(s) data. Required. type Character. File type download. Default: "PA" (outpatient production). See sia_info() 13 types. month Integer. Month(s) data (1-12). NULL (default), downloads 12 months. Example: 1 (January), 1:6 (first semester). vars Character vector. Variables keep. NULL (default), returns available variables. Use sia_variables() see available variables. uf Character. Two-letter state abbreviation(s) download. NULL (default), downloads 27 states. Example: "SP", c("SP", "RJ"). procedure Character. SIGTAP procedure code pattern(s) filter (PA_PROC_ID). Supports partial matching (prefix). NULL (default), returns procedures. Example: "0301" (consultations). diagnosis Character. CID-10 code pattern(s) filter principal diagnosis (PA_CIDPRI). Supports partial matching (prefix). NULL (default), returns diagnoses. Example: "J" (respiratory diseases). parse Logical. TRUE (default), converts columns appropriate types (integer, double, Date) based variable metadata. Use sia_variables() see target type variable. Set FALSE backward-compatible -character output. col_types Named list. Override default type specific columns. Names column names, values type strings: "character", "integer", "double", "date_dmy", "date_ymd", "date_ym", "date". Example: list(PA_VALAPR = "character") keep PA_VALAPR character. cache Logical. TRUE (default), caches downloaded data faster future access. cache_dir Character. Directory caching. Default: tools::R_user_dir("healthbR", "cache"). lazy Logical. TRUE, returns lazy query object instead tibble. Requires arrow package. lazy object supports dplyr verbs (filter, select, mutate, etc.) pushed query engine collecting memory. Call dplyr::collect() materialize result. Default: FALSE. backend Character. Backend lazy evaluation: "arrow" (default) "duckdb". used lazy = TRUE. DuckDB backend requires duckdb package.

title: Download SIA Outpatient Production Microdata — sia_data
text: tibble outpatient production microdata. Includes columns year, month, uf_source identify source multiple years/months/states combined.

title: Download SIA Outpatient Production Microdata — sia_data
text: Data downloaded DATASUS FTP .dbc files (one per type/state/month). .dbc format decompressed internally using vendored C code blast library. external dependencies required. SIA data monthly, downloading entire year states requires 324 files (27 UFs x 12 months) per type. Use uf month limit downloads. SIA 13 file types. default "PA" (outpatient production) commonly used. Use sia_info() see types.

title: Download SIA Outpatient Production Microdata — sia_data
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # all outpatient production in Acre, January 2022 ac_jan <- sia_data(year = 2022, month = 1, uf = "AC")  # filter by procedure code consult <- sia_data(year = 2022, month = 1, uf = "AC",                     procedure = "0301")  # filter by diagnosis (CID-10) resp <- sia_data(year = 2022, month = 1, uf = "AC",                  diagnosis = "J")  # only key variables sia_data(year = 2022, month = 1, uf = "AC",          vars = c("PA_PROC_ID", "PA_CIDPRI", "PA_SEXO",                   "PA_IDADE", "PA_VALAPR"))  # different file type (APAC Medicamentos) med <- sia_data(year = 2022, month = 1, uf = "AC", type = "AM") }

what: Download SIH Hospital Admission Microdata — sih_data
title: Download SIH Hospital Admission Microdata — sih_data
text: Downloads returns hospital admission microdata DATASUS FTP. row represents one hospital admission record (AIH). Data organized monthly – one .dbc file per state (UF) per month.

title: Download SIH Hospital Admission Microdata — sih_data
code: sih_data(   year,   month = NULL,   vars = NULL,   uf = NULL,   diagnosis = NULL,   parse = TRUE,   col_types = NULL,   cache = TRUE,   cache_dir = NULL,   lazy = FALSE,   backend = c("arrow", "duckdb") )

title: Download SIH Hospital Admission Microdata — sih_data
text: year Integer. Year(s) data. Required. month Integer. Month(s) data (1-12). NULL (default), downloads 12 months. Example: 1 (January), 1:6 (first semester). vars Character vector. Variables keep. NULL (default), returns available variables. Use sih_variables() see available variables. uf Character. Two-letter state abbreviation(s) download. NULL (default), downloads 27 states. Example: "SP", c("SP", "RJ"). diagnosis Character. CID-10 code pattern(s) filter principal diagnosis (DIAG_PRINC). Supports partial matching (prefix). NULL (default), returns diagnoses. Example: "I21" (acute myocardial infarction), "J" (respiratory). parse Logical. TRUE (default), converts columns appropriate types (integer, double, Date) based variable metadata. Use sih_variables() see target type variable. Set FALSE backward-compatible -character output. col_types Named list. Override default type specific columns. Names column names, values type strings: "character", "integer", "double", "date_dmy", "date_ymd", "date_ym", "date". Example: list(VAL_TOT = "character") keep VAL_TOT character. cache Logical. TRUE (default), caches downloaded data faster future access. cache_dir Character. Directory caching. Default: tools::R_user_dir("healthbR", "cache"). lazy Logical. TRUE, returns lazy query object instead tibble. Requires arrow package. lazy object supports dplyr verbs (filter, select, mutate, etc.) pushed query engine collecting memory. Call dplyr::collect() materialize result. Default: FALSE. backend Character. Backend lazy evaluation: "arrow" (default) "duckdb". used lazy = TRUE. DuckDB backend requires duckdb package.

text: Data downloaded DATASUS FTP .dbc files (one per state per month). .dbc format decompressed internally using vendored C code blast library. external dependencies required. SIH data monthly, downloading entire year states requires 324 files (27 UFs x 12 months). Use uf month limit downloads.

title: Download SIM Mortality Microdata — sim_data
text: Downloads returns mortality microdata DATASUS FTP. row represents one death record (Declaracao de Obito). Data downloaded per state (UF) compressed .dbc files, decompressed internally, returned tibble.

title: Download SIM Mortality Microdata — sim_data
code: sim_data(   year,   vars = NULL,   uf = NULL,   cause = NULL,   decode_age = TRUE,   parse = TRUE,   col_types = NULL,   cache = TRUE,   cache_dir = NULL,   lazy = FALSE,   backend = c("arrow", "duckdb") )

title: Download SIM Mortality Microdata — sim_data
text: year Integer. Year(s) data. Required. vars Character vector. Variables keep. NULL (default), returns available variables. Use sim_variables() see available variables. uf Character. Two-letter state abbreviation(s) download. NULL (default), downloads 27 states. Example: "SP", c("SP", "RJ"). cause Character. CID-10 code pattern(s) filter cause death (CAUSABAS). Supports partial matching (prefix). NULL (default), returns causes. Example: "I21" (infarct), "C" (neoplasms). decode_age Logical. TRUE (default), adds numeric column age_years age years decoded IDADE variable. parse Logical. TRUE (default), converts columns appropriate types (integer, double, Date) based variable metadata. Use sim_variables() see target type variable. Set FALSE backward-compatible -character output. col_types Named list. Override default type specific columns. Names column names, values type strings: "character", "integer", "double", "date_dmy", "date_ymd", "date_ym", "date". Example: list(PESO = "character") keep PESO character. cache Logical. TRUE (default), caches downloaded data faster future access. cache_dir Character. Directory caching. Default: tools::R_user_dir("healthbR", "cache"). lazy Logical. TRUE, returns lazy query object instead tibble. Requires arrow package. lazy object supports dplyr verbs (filter, select, mutate, etc.) pushed query engine collecting memory. Call dplyr::collect() materialize result. Default: FALSE. backend Character. Backend lazy evaluation: "arrow" (default) "duckdb". used lazy = TRUE. DuckDB backend requires duckdb package.

title: Download SIM Mortality Microdata — sim_data
text: tibble mortality microdata. Includes columns year uf_source identify source multiple years/states combined.

title: Download SIM Mortality Microdata — sim_data
text: Data downloaded DATASUS FTP .dbc files (one per state per year). .dbc format decompressed internally using vendored C code blast library. external dependencies required. uf specified, requested state(s) downloaded, making operation much faster downloading entire country.

title: Download SIM Mortality Microdata — sim_data
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # all deaths in Acre, 2022 ac_2022 <- sim_data(year = 2022, uf = "AC")  # deaths by infarct in Sao Paulo, 2020-2022 infarct_sp <- sim_data(year = 2020:2022, uf = "SP", cause = "I21")  # only key variables, Rio de Janeiro, 2022 sim_data(year = 2022, uf = "RJ",          vars = c("DTOBITO", "SEXO", "IDADE",                   "RACACOR", "CODMUNRES", "CAUSABAS")) }

NULL (default), returns available variables. Use sinan_variables() see available variables. parse Logical. TRUE (default), converts columns appropriate types (integer, double, Date) based variable metadata. Use sinan_variables() see target type variable. Set FALSE backward-compatible -character output. col_types Named list. Override default type specific columns. Names column names, values type strings: "character", "integer", "double", "date_dmy", "date_ymd", "date_ym", "date". Example: list(DT_NOTIFIC = "character") keep DT_NOTIFIC character. cache Logical. TRUE (default), caches downloaded data faster future access. cache_dir Character. Directory caching. Default: tools::R_user_dir("healthbR", "cache"). lazy Logical. TRUE, returns lazy query object instead tibble. Requires arrow package. lazy object supports dplyr verbs (filter, select, mutate, etc.) pushed query engine collecting memory. Call dplyr::collect() materialize result. Default: FALSE. backend Character. Backend lazy evaluation: "arrow" (default) "duckdb". used lazy = TRUE. DuckDB backend requires duckdb package.

title: Download SINAN Notifiable Disease Microdata — sinan_data

what: Download SINASC Live Birth Microdata — sinasc_data
title: Download SINASC Live Birth Microdata — sinasc_data
text: Downloads returns live birth microdata DATASUS FTP. row represents one live birth record (Declaracao de Nascido Vivo). Data downloaded per state (UF) compressed .dbc files, decompressed internally, returned tibble.

title: Download SINASC Live Birth Microdata — sinasc_data
code: sinasc_data(   year,   vars = NULL,   uf = NULL,   anomaly = NULL,   parse = TRUE,   col_types = NULL,   cache = TRUE,   cache_dir = NULL,   lazy = FALSE,   backend = c("arrow", "duckdb") )

title: Download SINASC Live Birth Microdata — sinasc_data
text: year Integer. Year(s) data. Required. vars Character vector. Variables keep. NULL (default), returns available variables. Use sinasc_variables() see available variables. uf Character. Two-letter state abbreviation(s) download. NULL (default), downloads 27 states. Example: "SP", c("SP", "RJ"). anomaly Character. CID-10 code pattern(s) filter congenital anomaly (CODANOMAL). Supports partial matching (prefix). NULL (default), returns records. Example: "Q90" (syndrome), "Q" (anomalies). parse Logical. TRUE (default), converts columns appropriate types (integer, double, Date) based variable metadata. Use sinasc_variables() see target type variable. Set FALSE backward-compatible -character output. col_types Named list. Override default type specific columns. Names column names, values type strings: "character", "integer", "double", "date_dmy", "date_ymd", "date_ym", "date". Example: list(PESO = "character") keep PESO character. cache Logical. TRUE (default), caches downloaded data faster future access. cache_dir Character. Directory caching. Default: tools::R_user_dir("healthbR", "cache"). lazy Logical. TRUE, returns lazy query object instead tibble. Requires arrow package. lazy object supports dplyr verbs (filter, select, mutate, etc.) pushed query engine collecting memory. Call dplyr::collect() materialize result. Default: FALSE. backend Character. Backend lazy evaluation: "arrow" (default) "duckdb". used lazy = TRUE. DuckDB backend requires duckdb package.

title: Download SINASC Live Birth Microdata — sinasc_data
text: tibble live birth microdata. Includes columns year uf_source identify source multiple years/states combined.

title: Download SINASC Live Birth Microdata — sinasc_data
text: Data downloaded DATASUS FTP .dbc files (one per state per year). .dbc format decompressed internally using vendored C code blast library. external dependencies required. uf specified, requested state(s) downloaded, making operation much faster downloading entire country.

title: Download SINASC Live Birth Microdata — sinasc_data
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # all births in Acre, 2022 ac_2022 <- sinasc_data(year = 2022, uf = "AC")  # births with anomalies in Sao Paulo, 2020-2022 anomalies_sp <- sinasc_data(year = 2020:2022, uf = "SP", anomaly = "Q")  # only key variables, Rio de Janeiro, 2022 sinasc_data(year = 2022, uf = "RJ",             vars = c("DTNASC", "SEXO", "PESO",                      "IDADEMAE", "PARTO", "CONSULTAS")) }

title: Download SI-PNI Vaccination Data — sipni_data
text: Downloads returns vaccination data SI-PNI. years 1994–2019, data downloaded DATASUS FTP (aggregated doses/coverage). years 2020+, data downloaded OpenDataSUS monthly CSV bulk files (individual-level microdata one row per vaccination dose).

title: Download SI-PNI Vaccination Data — sipni_data
code: sipni_data(   year,   type = "DPNI",   uf = NULL,   month = NULL,   vars = NULL,   parse = TRUE,   col_types = NULL,   cache = TRUE,   cache_dir = NULL,   lazy = FALSE,   backend = c("arrow", "duckdb") )

title: Download SI-PNI Vaccination Data — sipni_data
text: year Integer. Year(s) data. Required. type Character. File type FTP data (1994–2019). Default: "DPNI" (doses applied). Use "CPNI" vaccination coverage. Ignored years >= 2020 (API data always microdata). uf Character. Two-letter state abbreviation(s) download. NULL (default), downloads 27 states. Example: "SP", c("SP", "RJ"). month Integer. Month(s) download (1–12). years >= 2020 (CSV), selects monthly CSV files download. years <= 2019 (FTP), parameter ignored (FTP files annual). NULL (default), downloads 12 months. vars Character vector. Variables keep. NULL (default), returns available variables. Use sipni_variables() see available variables. parse Logical. TRUE (default), converts columns appropriate types (integer, double, Date) based variable metadata. Use sipni_variables() see target type variable. Set FALSE backward-compatible -character output. col_types Named list. Override default type specific columns. Names column names, values type strings: "character", "integer", "double", "date_dmy", "date_ymd", "date_ym", "date". Example: list(QT_DOSE = "character") keep QT_DOSE character. cache Logical. TRUE (default), caches downloaded data faster future access. cache_dir Character. Directory caching. Default: tools::R_user_dir("healthbR", "cache"). lazy Logical. TRUE, returns lazy query object instead tibble. Requires arrow package. lazy object supports dplyr verbs (filter, select, mutate, etc.) pushed query engine collecting memory. Call dplyr::collect() materialize result. Default: FALSE. backend Character. Backend lazy evaluation: "arrow" (default) "duckdb". used lazy = TRUE. DuckDB backend requires duckdb package.

title: Download SI-PNI Vaccination Data — sipni_data
text: tibble vaccination data. Includes columns year uf_source identify source multiple years/states combined. Output differs year range: 1994–2019 (FTP): Aggregated data DPNI (12 vars) CPNI (7 vars) columns, character. 2020+ (CSV): Individual-level microdata ~47 columns (snake_case Portuguese), character. Use sipni_variables(type = "API") see full list.

title: Download SI-PNI Vaccination Data — sipni_data
text: FTP data (1994–2019): Downloaded plain .DBF files. SI-PNI FTP data aggregated (dose counts coverage rates per municipality, vaccine, age group). Two file types: DPNI (doses) CPNI (coverage). CSV data (2020+): Downloaded OpenDataSUS monthly CSV bulk files (national, semicolon-delimited, latin1 encoding). monthly ZIP ~1.4 GB. individual-level microdata (one row per vaccination dose, ~47 fields per record). type parameter ignored CSV years. Data filtered UF chunked reading avoid loading full national file memory.

title: Download SI-PNI Vaccination Data — sipni_data
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # FTP: doses applied in Acre, 2019 ac_doses <- sipni_data(year = 2019, uf = "AC")  # FTP: vaccination coverage in Acre, 2019 ac_cob <- sipni_data(year = 2019, type = "CPNI", uf = "AC")  # API: microdata for Acre, January 2024 ac_api <- sipni_data(year = 2024, uf = "AC", month = 1)  # API: select specific variables sipni_data(year = 2024, uf = "AC", month = 1,            vars = c("descricao_vacina", "tipo_sexo_paciente",                     "data_vacina")) }

title: Download SISAB Coverage Data — sisab_data
code: sisab_data(   year,   type = "aps",   level = "uf",   month = NULL,   uf = NULL,   vars = NULL,   cache = TRUE,   cache_dir = NULL )

title: Download SISAB Coverage Data — sisab_data
text: year Integer. Year(s) data. Required. type Character. Report type download. Default: "aps" (APS coverage). See sisab_info() types. level Character. Geographic aggregation level. Default: "uf". One : "brazil", "region", "uf", "municipality". month Integer. Month(s) download (1–12). NULL (default), downloads 12 months. uf Character. Two-letter state abbreviation filter level "uf" "municipality". NULL (default), returns states. Example: "SP", c("SP", "RJ"). vars Character vector. Variables keep. NULL (default), returns available variables. Use sisab_variables() see available variables. cache Logical. TRUE (default), caches downloaded data faster future access. cache_dir Character. Directory caching. Default: tools::R_user_dir("healthbR", "cache").

title: Download SISAB Coverage Data — sisab_data
text: tibble coverage data. Includes columns year type identify source multiple years/types combined. Column names preserved API (camelCase).

title: Download SISAB Coverage Data — sisab_data
text: Data fetched relatorioaps REST API (https://relatorioaps.saude.gov.br), public reporting portal primary care Brazil. Four report types available: "aps" (default): APS coverage – number primary care teams (eSF, eAP, eSFR, eCR, eAPP) estimated coverage percentage. Available 2019. "sb": Oral health coverage – dental care teams coverage. Available 2024. "acs": Community health agents – number active ACS population coverage. Available 2007. "pns": PNS coverage – coverage estimates National Health Survey. Available 2020–2023. municipality-level data, recommended filter UF using uf parameter avoid large downloads.

title: Download SISAB Coverage Data — sisab_data
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # APS coverage by state, January 2024 sisab_data(year = 2024, month = 1)  # National total, full year 2023 sisab_data(year = 2023, level = "brazil")  # Oral health coverage by UF sisab_data(year = 2024, type = "sb", month = 6)  # Municipality level for Sao Paulo sisab_data(year = 2024, level = "municipality", uf = "SP", month = 1) }

title: Download VIGITEL microdata — vigitel_data
text: Downloads returns VIGITEL survey microdata Ministry Health. Data cached locally avoid repeated downloads. arrow package installed, data cached partitioned parquet format faster subsequent reads.

title: Download VIGITEL microdata — vigitel_data
code: vigitel_data(   year = NULL,   format = c("dta", "csv"),   vars = NULL,   cache_dir = NULL,   force = FALSE,   lazy = FALSE,   backend = c("arrow", "duckdb") )

title: Download VIGITEL microdata — vigitel_data
text: year Integer vector integers. Years return (2006-2024). Use NULL return years. Default NULL. format Character. File format download: "dta" (Stata, default) "csv". Stata format preserves variable labels. vars Character vector. Variables select. Use NULL variables. Default NULL. cache_dir Character. Directory caching downloaded files. Default uses tools::R_user_dir("healthbR", "cache"). force Logical. TRUE, re-download even file exists cache. Default FALSE. lazy Logical. TRUE, returns lazy query object instead tibble. Requires arrow package. lazy object supports dplyr verbs (filter, select, mutate, etc.) pushed query engine collecting memory. Call dplyr::collect() materialize result. Default: FALSE. backend Character. Backend lazy evaluation: "arrow" (default) "duckdb". used lazy = TRUE. DuckDB backend requires duckdb package.

title: Download VIGITEL microdata — vigitel_data
text: tibble VIGITEL microdata.

title: Download VIGITEL microdata — vigitel_data
text: VIGITEL survey (Vigilância de Fatores de Risco e Proteção para Doenças Crônicas por Inquérito Telefônico) conducted annually Brazilian Ministry Health state capitals Federal District. Data includes information : Demographics (age, sex, education, race) Health behaviors (smoking, alcohol, diet, physical activity) Health conditions (hypertension, diabetes, obesity) Healthcare utilization survey uses post-stratification weights (variable pesorake) produce population estimates. Always use weights statistical inference.

title: Download VIGITEL microdata — vigitel_data
text: arrow package installed, data cached partitioned parquet format. allows function read requested years without loading entire dataset memory. frequently work VIGITEL data, installing arrow highly recommended:

healthbR 0.14.0
text: Removed deprecated flat cache fallback code healthbR_migrate_cache() function. DATASUS modules now use Hive-style partitioned parquet exclusively (.rds fallback arrow installed). Removed 958 lines legacy compatibility code.

title: healthbR 0.14.0
text: Fixed PNS Arrow expression error: pns_data() used .character(year) partition filtering, Arrow infers Hive partition year=2019 int32. Changed .integer(year) (consistent PNADC). caused “Expression supported Arrow” reading partitioned cache. Fixed pns_sidra_data() unknown table warning: changed cli::cli_alert_warning() cli::cli_warn() expect_warning() can properly catch . Fixed cache path assertions PNADC, PNS, POF integration tests looked wrong directories partitioned/flat cache files. Made ANVISA sanitizers SINAN TUBE integration tests resilient transient server errors (skip instead fail).

title: healthbR 0.13.0
text: anvisa_types(), anvisa_info() module metadata anvisa_variables() variable exploration anvisa_data() downloading surveillance data anvisa_cache_status(), anvisa_clear_cache() cache management 12 data types: medications, cosmetics, foods, sanitizers, biological products, medical devices (product registrations); reference table; pharmacovigilance, hemovigilance, technovigilance (surveillance reports); SNGPC controlled substances antimicrobials (sales data). HTTP CSV/ZIP downloads dados.anvisa.gov.br Automatic delimiter detection (semicolon vs comma) SSL workaround ANVISA portal certificate issues Added vignette: “Health Surveillance Data ANVISA healthbR”

title: healthbR 0.12.0
text: ans_years(), ans_info() module metadata ans_variables() variable exploration ans_data() downloading beneficiary, complaint, financial data ans_operators() operator registry snapshot ans_cache_status(), ans_clear_cache() cache management 3 data types: beneficiaries (monthly per-UF, Apr 2019+), complaints (annual national, 2011+), financial statements (quarterly, 2007+). HTTP CSV/ZIP downloads dadosabertos.ans.gov.br Added vignette: “Supplementary Health Data ANS healthbR”

title: healthbR 0.12.0
text: Partitioned parquet cache: DATASUS modules now use Hive-style partitioned parquet datasets efficient per-partition reads. Lazy evaluation + DuckDB: *_data() functions support lazy=TRUE backend = "arrow" "duckdb" --memory queries. Parallel downloads: module download loops use .map_parallel() (furrr configured, purrr fallback). Concurrent HTTP downloads: SI-PNI multi-month CSV requests use curl::multi_download() concurrent fetching. Resumable downloads: .http_download_resumable() resumes partial HTTP downloads via Range headers (used SI-PNI large CSV files). Smart type parsing: 7 DATASUS modules support parse = TRUE (default) automatically convert numeric date columns. Use col_types fine-grained control parse = FALSE -character.

title: healthbR 0.12.0
text: Extracted shared validation helpers (.validate_year(), .validate_month(), .validate_uf(), .validate_quarter()) utils-validate.R, eliminating ~300 lines duplication across 9 modules. Extracted shared search helpers (.strip_accents(), .search_metadata()) utils-search.R, eliminating ~190 lines duplication across 11 modules. Extracted shared cache status/clear helpers (.cache_status(), .clear_cache()) utils-cache.R, eliminating ~340 lines duplication across 8 modules. Extracted shared return helpers (.try_lazy_cache(), .data_return()) consistent pre/post-download lazy evaluation across 6 DATASUS modules. Removed unused vroom Suggests. Moved readxl haven Imports Suggests.

title: healthbR 0.11.0

title: healthbR 0.6.1
text: Fixed POF dictionary parsing failure Linux/Ubuntu. utils::unzip() creates filenames invalid UTF-8 bytes non-Windows systems, caused grepl() nchar() silently fail. Dictionary file lookup now uses byte-level matching (useBytes = TRUE, nchar(type = "bytes")) renames extracted files ASCII-safe names prevent downstream encoding errors. Moved POF register validation download pof_dictionary(), invalid register names caught immediately without triggering download.

title: healthbR 0.2.0
text: Complete refactoring VIGITEL functions due Ministry Health website restructuring. Data now distributed single consolidated file containing years (2006-2024) instead separate files per year. vigitel_data() API changed: New format parameter choose Stata (.dta) CSV formats year parameter now defaults NULL (returns years) Removed lazy parallel parameters (replaced automatic parquet caching) Removed force_download parameter (replaced force) Removed vigitel_download() vigitel_convert_to_parquet() functions. longer needed data processing handled automatically. vigitel_variables() longer requires year parameter. Returns full data dictionary.

title: healthbR 0.2.0
text: Added 2022 2024 data (newly available Ministry Health). Available years now span 2006-2024 (19 years). vigitel_data() now supports downloading data Stata (.dta) CSV format via format parameter. Stata format recommended preserves variable labels. Automatic partitioned parquet caching: arrow package installed, data automatically cached partitioned parquet format. enables efficient reading specific years without loading entire dataset. Performance improvement: reading single year cache now extremely fast year’s partition loaded. Added haven readr Imports reading Stata CSV files. Added survey Suggests complex survey analysis support.
